poem:
Title: "In the Theatre of Divided Skies"

A gilt tower, he ascends once more,
revisiting the escalator's chore.
Banana republic echoes,
the Kangaroo jumps and Lawless row,
Witch-hunt cries amidst guilty scores.
Shamed history taps on remorse's door.
"Unruly, yet they rally!"
echoes the blinkered party's tally,
Convicted, yet still dons the crown,
in wake of order's tumbled town.
